item.title: Palace suspends classes in NCR, parts of Luzon
item.description: (Update 2) Executive Secretary Paquito Ochoa Jr. on Sunday night (September 14) ordered the suspension of classes in all levels in the National Capital Region (NCR) and selected areas of Luzon for Monday (September 15) due to inclement weather brought about by Typhoon Luis.

item.title: Typhoon Luis slams northern PH, cuts power lines
item.description: (Update 1) Typhoon “Luis” (international codename: Kalmaegi) slammed the northern part of the Philippines on Sunday (September 14), cutting power and communications lines and forcing people to flee to higher ground, national disaster agency officials said.

item.title: Signal No. 3 up in 9 areas as ‘Luis’ pummels N.Luzon
item.description: (Update 1) As expected, Typhoon “Luis" made landfall in Northern Luzon early evening Sunday (September 14), pounding Isabela and its nearby areas, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said.

item.title: 3 dead in ferry mishap off Southern Leyte
item.description: (Update 1) Three people were killed as rescuers searched for at least three others still missing with more than a hundred rescued after a ferry sank in waters off Southern Leyte, the government said Sunday (September 14).

item.title: 658 passengers stranded due to Typhoon Luis
item.description: A total of 658 seagoing passengers in Southern Luzon were stranded on Sunday (September 14) due to rough weather caused by Typhoon Luis, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said.

item.title: Manila lifts truck ban
item.description: After almost seven months of standing pat on imposing a truck ban in the country's capital city, Manila Mayor Joseph Estrada finally relented on Saturday (September 13) and lifted the controversial ordinance.

item.title: PH starts inquiry into Filipino militants in Syria
item.description: The Philippines is investigating the involvement of Filipino Islamists in the three-year civil war in Syria after two locals were reported killed fighting for Islamic State militant group, an intelligence official said on Saturday (September 13).

item.title: Signal #2 up in Cagayan, Isabela
item.description: Tropical Storm "Luis" intensified further as it continued to move towards the Cagayan-Isabela area, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said on Saturday afternoon (September 13). Public Storm Warning Signal No. 2 has been raised in Isabela and Cagayan provinces late afternoon.

item.title: Chinese trader kidnapped in Zambo Sibugay
item.description: Military and police forces are in pursuit of six unidentified armed men who kidnapped a Chinese businessman in Kabalasan, Zamboanga Sibugay on Thursday (September 11).

item.title: PH displays ancient maps to debunk China's sea claims
item.description: The Philippines on Thursday put on display dozens of ancient maps which officials said showed that China's territorial claims over the South China Sea did not include a disputed shoal at the center of an acrimonious standoff.
